business.headline: November blues for mutual funds as equity inflows down 14%: AMFI data Investment through systematic investment plans (SIPs) remained steady in November. Total SIP inflows stood at Rs 25,319.66 crore, showing little change from October's Rs 25,323 crore.

Who is Sanjay Malhotra? 5 things to know about the new RBI GovernorAs Shaktikanta Das bids farewell, Sanjay Malhotra takes charge as the 26th RBI Governor on December 11, bringing decades of experience to the role.

One RBI Governor to another: What Shaktikanta Das had to say on Sanjay MalhotraShaktikanta Das spoke highly of Sanjay Malhotra, who is set to take over as the new RBI Governor for a three-year term, effective Wednesday, December 11.
Reliance eyes $3 billion in India's largest loan deal since 2023: ReportThe loan comes at a time when the Indian rupee has been under pressure, recently hitting a record low against the US dollar.
ITI shares surge nearly 10% to a record high, up 39% this weekITI share price: ITI shares have been on an exceptional run, gaining 15% in Monday's session and over 13% the day before.

Immensely grateful: Shaktikanta Das thanks PM Modi on last day as RBI GovernorIn a series of tweets, Das extended his thanks to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, various stakeholders, including financial sector participants, economists, industry bodies.
Sensex, Nifty open flat as auto stocks shed in early trade; Swiggy up 4% The S&P BSE Sensex was down 10.62 points to 81,497.84, while the Nifty50 lost 1.85 points to 24,617.15.

Boeing layoffs: Hundreds in Washington and California face job lossesBoeing Layoffs: The recent layoffs are part of a larger reduction that aims to cut around 17,000 jobs from Boeing's global workforce.
Edelweiss' Radhika Gupta explains why fixed income MFs belong in your portfolioFixed-income MFs, as Radhika Gupta suggests, enhance equity portfolios with stability, flexibility, and tax efficiency.

Stocks to watch today: Adani stocks, Vodafone Idea, Godrej Consumer, Tata MotorsAs markets open today, several stocks, including Vodafone Idea, Adani stocks, Tata Motors, etc are likely to be in focus due to recent announcements and developments.
Sanjay Malhotra appointed as new RBI GovernorThe government on Monday appointed Revenue Secretary Sanjay Malhotra as the next Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor.

1990-batch IAS, IITian: Meet Sanjay Malhotra, newly-appointed RBI GovernorCurrently serving as the Revenue Secretary in the Ministry of Finance, Malhotra has over 33 years of diverse experience spanning finance, taxation, power, information technology, and mining.

Aditya Birla Group set to invest Rs 50,000 crore in Rajasthan: Kumar Mangalam BirlaAddressing the Rising Rajasthan Summit in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Kumar Mangalam Birla said, "Across our businesses, we are committed to significantly scaling up our investments. I foresee the Group investing over Rs 50,000 crore in the next few years."

Aditya Birla Group to invest Rs 50,000 crore in Rajasthan: Kumar Mangalam BirlaSpeaking at the Rising Rajasthan Summit in the presence of PM Narendra Modi, Kumar Mangalam Birla highlighted the state's potential driven by its mineral wealth, infrastructure, tourism, and renewable energy capacity.
Sanjay Malhotra appointed new RBI Governor, to succeed Shaktikanta DasRevenue Secretary Sanjay Malhotra has been appointed as the new Reserve Bank of India Governor.

Air India places order to purchase 100 more Airbus aircraftThis new purchase comes in addition to the 470 aircraft already ordered from Airbus and Boeing in 2023, boosting Air India's total Airbus orders this year to 350 aircraft.
HDFC Bank hikes MCLR for short-term loans. What borrowers need to knowHDFC Bank raises MCLR for short-term loans by 5 bps, affecting borrowing costs and EMIs, while long-term rates remain unchanged.

Sensex, Nifty end lower as FMCG stocks witness decline; Godrej Consumer down 9%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 200.66 points to close at 81,508.46, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 58.80 points to end at 24,619.00.

Adani Group unveils Rs 7.5 lakh crore investment plan for RajasthanKaran Adani, Managing Director of Adani Ports & Special Economic Zone, made the announcement while addressing the Rising Rajasthan Global Investment Summit held in Jaipur.
Dabur, Marico, Godrej Consumer: Why major FMCG stocks are tumbling todayGodrej Consumer Products shares declined as much as 11% in early trade and was the top loser among all major FMCG companies.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Trinamool's 'Mamata Banerjee should lead INDIA' finds more backers, rift deepensEver since Mamata Banerjee set off a churn by evincing interest in leading the INDIA bloc last week, several non-Congress leaders have closed ranks behind her, with Lalu Prasad Yadav being the latest addition.

Techie dies by suicide, details harassment by wife in tragic 24-page note, videoA 34-year-old techie died by suicide at his Bengaluru residence, leaving behind a 24-page note blaming his wife and her family for harassment. An FIR has been filed against his wife and relatives following a complaint by his brother.

Create more jobs instead of only providing free ration: Supreme Court to CentreThe Supreme Court said the state governments may keep on issuing ration cards to appease the people, since they know that the liability to provide the grains rests with the Centre.

Video: Bangladeshi politician's boycott India call, burns Jaipur-made bedsheetBNP leader Ruhul Kabir Rizvi ordered party members to burn the India-made bedsheet as a protest against what he described as recent incidents in India that have angered Bangladeshis.

Trump calls Trudeau 'Governor of Canada' as tariff war tensions mountTrump's comments about "Governor Trudeau" stemmed from a joke he made during a private dinner earlier this month at his Florida estate, where the two leaders clashed over proposed trade tariffs and border security.

When SM Krishna abandoned Congress after 46 years, said party had no futureVeteran politician SM Krishna, who passed away on Tuesday, resigned from the Indian National Congress in 2017 after 46 years of association. Krishna, who is known as the 'Architect of Brand Bengaluru', said the Congress had no future and mentioned how he took the hard decision to protect his self-respect and dignity.

Mohammed Siraj should not taken even a step backwards: Ravi ShastriFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri feels that Mohammed Siraj should not take even a step backwards and continue his aggressive approach in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy. Siraj had a bust-up with Travis Head in the Adelaide Test match.

Isro successfully conducts Gaganyaan recovery trial with NavyThis crucial test involved simulating the recovery of the Crew Module, which will be used to bring astronauts back to Earth after their mission.

Will Syria chaos fuel ISIS comeback?Syria was a major base of the Islamic State (IS) terror group. Will the vacuum after the fall of the Assad regime see the growth of the group now contained in small pockets? The antecedents of Syrian rebel leaders like Abu Muhammad al-Jolani make it a real possibility.

Rs 125 crore in assets returned to victims in Mehul Choksi-PNB scam caseAs per the court's order, the ED initiated the transfer of assets, starting with properties worth Rs 125 crore. This includes flats in Mumbai and factories/godowns in SEEPZ Mumbai.

Nurse going to hospital, teen returning home: Victims of Mumbai bus accidentA bus crash in Mumbai's Kurla area on Monday night killed six people, including a 19-year-old teen and a 55-year-old nurse, and left 43 others injured. The driver, Sanjay More, has been arrested. Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis announced compensation for the victims' families.

Mahayuti cabinet expansion likely on December 14, big names may be droppedDevendra Fadnavis took oath as chief minister almost two weeks after the Mahayuti (grand alliance) in Maharashtra secured a landslide election victory.

No one was fired: Startup YesMadam apologises for distress caused by viral emailIn a statement issued on social media, YesMadam said that the viral email was a 'planned effort' and denied firing any employees following severe backlash.

Came on time, you were late: Congress MP jokes with Rahul Gandhi on punctualityRahul Gandhi and Congress MP Sukhjinder Singh Randhawa were seen having a banter on punctuality after the Leader of the Opposition chaired a meeting of party MPs in the Lok Sabha.
Google's new chip solves in 5 minutes what classical computers take eons to doGoogle says it has achieved a breakthrough in quantum computing with its new chip.

Row over Lalu Prasad's vulgar jibe at Nitish Kumar, NDA says he needs helpRJD chief Lalu Yadav sparked controversy on Tuesday with a sexist comment about Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's Mahila Samwad Yatra, suggesting it was intended to "letch at women".

Meet Anouska Kale, the British Indian student elected Cambridge Union presidentAnoushka Kale, a British Indian student at Cambridge, was elected the new president of the historic Cambridge Union, one of the world's oldest debating societies. Kale wants to focus on diversity and reducing access costs while continuing its global debate legacy.

Why CPI(M) in Kerala faces cadre dissent in the midst of organisational pollsDiscontent over area committee appointments in the party has prompted protests from workers and loyalty shifts to the BJP at many places

Rohit Sharma at No.6, 2 changes to India lineup: Harbhajan's Brisbane predictionHarbhajan Singh feels that India will stick with the same batting order for the Brisbane Test and Rohit Sharma will continue batting at the No.6 spot. Harbhajan also feels India will make 2 changes to the lineup.

Priyanka Gandhi on BJP's alleged George Soros-Sonia Gandhi link: RidiculousParliament Session: The comments were in response to BJP chief JP Nadda, who alleged that Sonia Gandhi and the Congress have links with George Soros, claiming an association with an organisation funded by the Soros Foundation, which allegedly backed the idea of separating Kashmir from India.
Can you live forever like Bryan Johnson wants to?Can money, science, and obsession really cheat death? US tech millionaire Bryan Johnson thinks so.

Farming yields Rs 4,500 a month, less than what you'd splurge on a dinner dateFarmers in India aren't a pampered lot as they are perceived to be. A farming family ends up earning just Rs 4,500 a month from agriculture, according to a Nabard study. Even after resorting to all other avenues, including non-farm jobs, a farming household manages just Rs 13,600 a month.

Priyanka Gandhi carries 'PM-Adani' bag to Parliament, Rahul Gandhi calls it cuteParliament Session: Priyanka Gandhi's dig at the Central government is the latest in the series of attacks by the Opposition on Central government for avoiding a discussion on the bribery charges in the US against Adani.

One RBI Governor to another: What Shaktikanta Das had to say on Sanjay MalhotraShaktikanta Das spoke highly of Sanjay Malhotra, who is set to take over as the new RBI Governor for a three-year term, effective Wednesday, December 11.

Inside Aaliyah Kashyap-Shane Gregoire's glamorous pre-wedding festivitiesAaliyah Kashyap and Shane Gregoire's pre-wedding celebrations, including a mehendi and cocktail party, saw Anurag Kashyap, Khushi Kapoor, and Ibrahim Ali Khan, among others in attendance.

Video: Katrina Kaif-Vicky Kaushal in Mumbai after celebrating 3rd anniversaryKatrina Kaif and Vicky Kaushal, who celebrated their third wedding anniversary in Rajasthan on December 9, arrived in Mumbai on Tuesday. For her airport look, the Merry Christmas actor amped her casual outfits with a long coat. Vicky wore a casual black sweatshirt with jogger pants.

Chiyaan Vikram's Thangalaan quietly arrives on OTT after 17-week waitThangalaan, starring Chiyaan Vikram, has arrived on Netflix, surprising fans. The film explores historical themes of gold quest and rebellion.

Actor Jamie Foxx on his 'mystery illness': Don't remember 20 daysOscar-winning star Jamie Foxx recently opened up about his illness during his Netflix special What Had Happened Was. The actor said he has no recollection of at least 20 days that he passed during the trying time.

sports.headline: Adam Gilchrist delighted to see 'aggressive' Pat Cummins back in Adelaide winFormer Australia cricketer Adam Gilchrist is in awe of 'aggressive' Pat Cummins after Australia's dominating ten-wicket during the second Test against India in Adelaide.

Against Red Kookaburra in Gabba, Rohit might be better off batting at No.6Where should Rohit Sharma bat in the Brisbane Test match? Should Rohit open the innings and displace KL Rahul or should he continue to bat in the middle order? Batting expert weighs in Ahead of the 3rd Test match.

Siraj had a bust-up with Travis Head in the Adelaide Test match.

Alisson available for Liverpool's Champions League clash with Girona: Arne SlotLiverpool boss Arne Slot has claimed that Alisson fit and available for the upcoming UEFA Champions League clash against Girona on December 10. Liverpool leads the UEFA Champions League points table.

Injury-free Kamlesh Nagarkoti excited to live the dream of playing with MS DhoniYoung Indian pacer Kamlesh Nagarkoti shared his excitement to play alongside legendary India cricketer MS Dhoni after being bought by Chennai Super Kings (CSK) for IPL 2025.

Babysitter Rishabh Pant is back: India star plays with fan's kid in AdelaideBabysitter Rishabh Pant is back in Australia as he had a playful interaction with a fan's kid in Adelaide. This incident brought back fond memories from the 2018-19 BGT series when Tim Paine asked Pant to baby sit his kids.

Abu Dhabi T10 league's former assistant coach banned under anti-corruptionSunny Dhillon, a former assistant coach of a franchise team in the Abu Dhabi T10 Cricket League, has been banned from all forms of cricket for six years.

Rohit Sharma at No.6, 2 changes to India lineup: Harbhajan's Brisbane predictionHarbhajan Singh feels that India will stick with the same batting order for the Brisbane Test and Rohit Sharma will continue batting at the No.6 spot. Harbhajan also feels India will make 2 changes to the lineup.

Boxing Day Test match set to see sold-out crowd on Day 1 in MelbourneIND vs AUS: Day 1 of the Boxing match is set to have a sell-out crowd. Cricket Australia informed that the trend of attendance records is set to continue in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.

South Africa vs Pakistan 1st T20I live-streaming: When and where to watch liveSA vs PAK: South Africa will host Pakistan for a three-match T20I series, starting December 10 on Tuesday. Find out the live-streaming details of the contest.

Fiorentina's Edoardo Bove to have removable defibrillator fitted after scareFiorentina midfielder Edoardo Bove will undergo surgery to implant a removable heart starter device after collapsing during the match against Inter Milan. The procedure is necessary for his discharge from the hospital, but Serie A regulations prohibit playing with such a device.

Simon Katich expects series to get more heated after Siraj-Head bust upIND vs AUS: Former Australia batter Simon Katich expects the Border-Gavaskar Trophy to get more heated after the Mohammed Siraj-Travis Head bust-up. Katich said that what Siraj did was uncalled for.

Sardar-esque Hardik Singh a future India captain contender: UP Rudras' RussellIn an exclusive interaction with Indiatoday.In, UP Rudras defender Kane Russell opened up on the similarities between captain Hardik Singh and the great Sardar Singh. Russell also commented on the impact Hockey India League will have on the sport and what fans can expect from the UP Rudras this season.

OTD in 2022: Ishan Kishan smashed the fastest double hundred in ODIs vs BANOn December 10 in 2022, Ishan Kishan smashed the fastest double hundred in the ODI history. At the age of 24, he also became the youngest player to score a double hundred.

Virat Kohli makes critical changes ahead of Gabba Test: Harbhajan breaks it downVirat Kohli made some critical changes in his game ahead of the 3rd Test at the Gabba. Harbhajan Singh pointed out that Kohli was working on his back-foot game to tackle the bounce.

Harbhajan Singh hopes Head-Siraj row ends after ICC sanctions: Enough is enoughFormer spinner Harbhajan Singh is hoping that the Mohammed Siraj-Travis Head has come to an end after both men were given sanctions by the ICC for their actions during the Adelaide Test. Both Siraj and Head were given one demerit point for their actions and the Indian pacer was also fined 20 percent of his match fees.

No change to India's batting order in intense training session in AdelaideIndia players went straight into the nets after their heavy loss in Adelaide. KL Rahul and Yashavsi Jaiswal continued to come out to bat first in the nets, indicating that they might continue to open in the Test series.

Why India should not drop Harshit Rana for Brisbane TestIndia pacer Harshit Rana copped a lot of criticism for his bowling in the pink ball Test match at Adelaide. However, the India team should persist with the pacer for at least one more Test match, set to be played in Brisbane.

Virat Kohli makes critical changes ahead of Gabba Test: Harbhajan breaks it downVirat Kohli made some critical changes in his game ahead of the 3rd Test at the Gabba. Harbhajan Singh pointed out that Kohli was working on his back-foot game to tackle the bounce.

Both Siraj and Head were given one demerit point for their actions and the Indian pacer was also fined 20 percent of his match fees.

Real Madrid will have to play UEFA Champions League playoffs: Carlo AncelottiReal Madrid manager Carlo Ancelotti has admitted that his side may have to get into the next round of the UEFA Champions League through the playoffs ahead of their clash with Atalanta on Tuesday, December 10.

Justin Langer's sacking helped Travis Head flourish: Tim PaineFormer Australia captain Tim Paine feels that the sacking of Justin Langer was key to Travis Head flourishing in all formats of the game. Paine said that the freedom that Pat Cummins and Andrew McDonald have given Head has helped him reach the peak of his prowess.

Someone should chat with Mohammed Siraj: Mark Taylor on pacer's 'celebrappeals'Border-Gavaskar Trophy: Former Australia captain Mark Taylor said that someone needs to have a chat with India pacer Mohammed Siraj about his celebrappeals during matches before he lands in further trouble. Siraj was under the spotlight in Adelaide for his action during the pink-ball Test.

Joe Root vs Sachin Tendulkar: Comparing their numbers after 151 TestsEngland's Joe Root, currently at the peak of his career, is being tipped as a strong contender to surpass Sachin Tendulkar's all-time Test records. With Root completing 151 Test matches, let's look at how the two batting icons measure up at this stage of their illustrious careers.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
